Jame finally wised up, and here is what he says:

messages.raw:
JAME TESTS THE WATERS

Dear Miracsky,
I am sorry for the delay, it was dew to my treatment.

Thanks for your reply to my request for urgent assistance. First and foremost, I would like to stand by informing you that I am a well know philanthropist here in my country and don't went the efforts I put in, the past years in bettering the life of the needy people to be tanished just for the fact that i am on sick bed. So I assume that you are a trusty worthy person that can help in achieving my goal.

However, I wish to explain to you here all the modalities and what I have in the Netherlands. I have one metal box contains US$10.5 and weighing about 26kg and all in US$100 Bills. This consignment was Ship to Holland in 1998 and has since been in the kault of the security company. The consignment was shipped as artifacts and personal belongings. Therefore, the security company does not know it content (money) until when you will tell them to make X-ray of the box.

In the light of things, you shall be required to go to the Netherlands and pick up the funds on my behalf. You are doing this for the fact that I am on sick bed and for what the doctors are saying, I have few months to live When you pick up the fund, you can now help me to deliver it to an orphanage in London or any orphanage home close to you.

For your assistance and co-operation, 15% of the funds goes to you, while 5% has been mapped out for any expenses that might crop up during the course of this transaction.

Thank and God Bless you.
Best regard,
Jame Peter.

messages.subject: Re: : VERY GOOD
messages.body:
Dear Mr Ja

I have considered your kind offer of employment very carefully and I
must admit the idea of foreign travel, and of making new friends
around the world appeals to me. However, after a careful weighing up
of my experience to date, and the expections which an honest person
might possibly bring to your grubby little enterprises, I feel that
sadly, I should decline.

Unfortunately I lack any knowledge of robbing the gullible, or
thieving from the old and the weak. I would feel guilty at cheating
and lieing, or when preying on people online. Neither do I have your
unbounded optimism, that idiotic persistence which an incompetent
con-artist requires to retain his dubious motivation. I am also sure

hardly suit one who enjoys sunshine and a lack of prosecution.
However I wish you the very worst in your search for staff, and

messages.raw:
ILICHY: NO WAY

From: Ilichy Miracsky
To: Jame Peter Ja [jamepeter@rediffmail.com]
Date: 03 Sep 2002, 05:48:08 AM
Subject: Re: : VERY GOOD

Dear Mr Ja

I have considered your kind offer of employment very carefully and I must admit the idea of foreign travel, and of making new friends around the world appeals to me. However, after a careful weighing up of my experience to date, and the expections which an honest person might possibly bring to your grubby little enterprises, I feel that sadly, I should decline.

Unfortunately I lack any knowledge of robbing the gullible, or thieving from the old and the weak. I would feel guilty at cheating and lieing, or when preying on people online. Neither do I have your unbounded optimism, that idiotic persistence which an incompetent con-artist requires to retain his dubious motivation. I am also sure that (in your case) the inevitable, long, periods in detention would hardly suit one who enjoys sunshine and a lack of prosecution.

However I wish you the very worst in your search for staff, and trust that you find the success you so richly deserve.
